intro: Chondrilla juncea var. acanthophylla, commonly known as the hairy leaf desertweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with limited water availability. It has a low, spreading growth habit and produces small, elongated seeds. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in disturbed soils and can be a pioneer species in ecological succession.
